content: The state of Oklahoma approved the first ever Religious Charter school in the United States.
Mike Pence files paperwork to run for president in 2024.
President Biden signs the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023 into law in an effort to prevent the United States from entering a debt ceiling default.
Fort Bragg, originally named for Confederate General Braxton Bragg, is renamed Fort Liberty.
Nvidia becomes the first chipmaker valued at over $1 trillion, amid the ongoing AI boom.
Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO and founder of blood-testing company Theranos, begins an 11-year prison sentence for defrauding investors.
2023 United States debt-ceiling crisis: House Republicans and the White House reach a deal to raise the debt ceiling and prevent the United States from defaulting.
In a 121-23 vote, the Texas House of Representatives votes to impeach Attorney General Ken Paxton, the third impeachment in the state's history.
Ron DeSantis launches his campaign to run for President of the United States.
United States Attorney for the District of Massachusetts Rachael Rollins resigns after an ethics probe finds that she had grossly violated multiple policies and lied under oath.
